result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen K Umentum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to any other probation.
8/21/17 - Length of probation amended from 3 years to 2 years per Statute. DTE

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. Cash bond applied toward restitution owing.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Must write one 100 word apology letter for both victims. This to be done within the first 30 days of probation.

To pay the costs of the action for each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence. Huber release granted. Credit for time served. 30 days to report.
1/18/18 - Court grants additional 2 days sentence credit.
4/12/18 - If DCSD okay with it, Court has no problem with defendant serving sentence in Milwaukee County.  DTE
To pay the costs of the action. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
Court converts restitution owing to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: from defendant requesting that language be added to JOC indicating jail sentence can be transferred to Milwaukee County.    Court responds:  I have granted you huber. Issue of transfer to another county is between you and jail. DTE  Revised response from court:  If DCSD okay with it, I have no problem with amending JOC to allow him to serve sentence in Milwaukee. DTE
Motion for release pending appeal by defendant.  Denied.  DTE

Defendant Allen K Umentum in court, in custody.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is ready to proceed without an attorney.  Court reviews events in file, reviews defendants request for furlough and sentence modification.  Court not granting furlough to attend court proceedings in other counties. If other counties want to transport him, that's up to them. Court addresses defendant's request for sentence modification. Defendant makes statement, explains what he's trying to ask for of the court.  As to the issue of medical treatment, Court feels that issue is between jail staff and defendant. Regarding sentence modification, Court not altering sentence today.

from defendant for a furlough/sentence modification.   Defendant is currently in the Waukesha Co. Jail. Court will set hearing upon defendants return to the Door County Jail. DTE/SR

from Atty Schmaus for furlough for defendant to attend out of county court appearances.   Court denies request. Those counties can writ him to appear. DTE

DC Jail request for sentence modification - Defendant requests furlough to attend out of county court hearings and meet with his doctors regarding medical needs. Court denies request. if other counties want to transport him, they can do writs and transport him there for his court dates. DTE

Defendant Allen K Umentum in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Defendant makes statement regarding sentence credit he feels he wasn't given credit for.  Discussion regarding dates in custody. Court grants 2 more days sentence credit. Court orders clerk to amend JOC adding 2 more days sentence credit. Court has questions regarding his appeal. Court indicates defendant hasn't filed a notice of appeal, advises defendant to contact an attorney regarding that issue.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Allen K Umentum in court, in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Judge Ehlers leaves courtroom so defendant can discuss matter with ADA Grode. Back on the record. Defendant explains where he feels matter is at. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defendant gives sentencing argument, makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 2, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Allen K Umentum in court, in custody.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Defendant would like to talk to DA about a few matters, indicates he has not seen the revocation packet yet. Court not comfortable proceeding until defendant has seen the revocation packet or talked to an atty about what he's facing. Court adjourns matter, will have clerk send waiver of right to atty form and copy of revocation packet down to the jail for defendant to fill out and review. Court will have JA reschedule matter this week sometime.
from defendant requesting bond hearing awaiting sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 30, 2017 at 09:45 am.
from Janelle Nehring of DOC indicating max. term of probation allowed for both counts is 2 years. Court amends JOC to show 2 years probation for Cts. 1 & 3. DTE
Restitution Breakdown
Restitution Breakdown

Defendant Allen K Umentum in court with attorney Gary R Schmaus.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to Misd. Theft, gives plea agreement. State moves to dismiss Repeater enhancer on Cts. 1 & 3.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 as charged.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 as charged. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
from Atty Schmaus requesting phone appearance for 5/04/17 hearing. State has no objection.

Defendant Allen K Umentum and attorney Gary R Schmaus appear by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from Atty Schmaus received yesterday. Atty Schmaus indicates he's waiting on an offer from Waukesha County, once he has that offer, feels this matter will be resolved. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Copy of letter from Hartford Police Dept. indicating new charges pending for defendant in Hartford.
from Atty Schmaus requesting phone appearance and waiving appearance for defendant.

Attorney Gary R Schmaus appears by phone.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions counsel on where matter is at. Atty Schmaus indicates defendant has charges pending in 5 counties, is hoping to consolidate all matters and come up with a joint resolution. Atty Schmaus requests another status in late March. State has no objection to adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2017 at 11:30 am.
from Atty Schmaus requesting phone appearance for 2/20/17 hearing. Court grants request. Hearing moved to 3:30 on 2/20/17.
Status conference on February 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Schmaus requesting adjournment of 1/19/16 hearing to mid February as defendant is still in custody in Washington County. Court reschedules.

from Washington County Jail for court on 1/19/17.
from Atty Schmaus requesting adjourment to mid Janauary 2017. Court reschedules.
Status conference on January 19, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Attorney Gary R Schmaus appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schmaus indicates defendant is currently serving a sentence in Washington County due to discharge the end of January/beginning of February 2017. Atty Schmaus would like to work out a global resolution on all cases pending in all counties but is taking longer than he anticipated. Atty Schmaus would like a status in mid December. State has no objection to adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
from Atty Schmaus dated 8/19/16 requesting phone appearance for 8/22/16 hearing and that defendant be excused for hearing. Court grants requests.

Attorney Gary R Schmaus appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from Atty Schmaus regarding phone appearance today. Atty Schmaus indicates defendant is also in his office listening to todays hearing. Atty Schmaus requests a plea date in 45-60 days. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Allen K Umentum in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Reetz indicates he hasn't been retained yet, will not be appearing with defendant today. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant requests time to check with PD to see if he qualifies or retain own atty. Defendant indicates he does not agree with the repeater status associated with the charges. Court encourages defendant not to say anything else about the charges. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Allen K Umentum appears by video conference along with attorney Brett E Reetz who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 2/01/16 at 10:00 am.
